course.title: Enterprise UI
course.description: This course teaches senior frontend engineers how to scale applications beyond a single-team SPA — covering composition patterns, operational infrastructure, and migration strategies.

lessons.title: Exercise 6: Architectural Linting
lessons.description: Configure eslint-plugin-boundaries to encode the intended dependency graph as lint rules, preventing cross-package internal imports and circular dependencies.

lessons.title: Exercise 2: Build-Time Composition
lessons.description: Take the same analytics module from Exercise 1 and consume it as a regular workspace package in a monorepo — no remote entry, no shared dependency negotiation, just an npm import.

lessons.title: Exercise 7: CI/CD Pipeline
lessons.description: Build a GitHub Actions workflow that runs the full quality gate on every push, uses Turborepo for caching, and adds Lighthouse CI performance budgets to catch regressions before they ship.

lessons.title: Design System Governance
lessons.description: How to treat a design system as a platform contract across independently deployed applications—tokens, components, CSS isolation, enforcement, and the organizational patterns that keep it all from drifting apart.

lessons.title: Exercise 4: Monorepo Setup
lessons.description: Create a Turborepo configuration to get cached, dependency-aware builds. Experience the difference between rebuilding everything and FULL TURBO cache hits.

lessons.title: Exercise 1: Runtime Composition
lessons.description: Wire up a Module Federation host shell and remote analytics module, configure shared dependency negotiation, and solve the cross-boundary state management problem using nanostores.

lessons.title: Scaling TypeScript
lessons.description: Where TypeScript starts to buckle under the weight of a large codebase, and the strategies that keep your tooling fast as the project grows.

lessons.title: Exercise 9: Strangler Fig & Codemods
lessons.description: Set up a routing-level strangler fig so legacy and modern apps coexist, migrate one route, and write a jscodeshift codemod that automates import transformations for the rest of the codebase.

lessons.title: The Strangler Fig Pattern
lessons.description: An incremental replacement strategy for legacy systems: keep a stable front door, move one slice at a time, and delete the old path when the new one proves itself.

lessons.title: Exercise 3: Streaming & Suspense
lessons.description: Add Suspense boundaries around independently-fetching components and implement renderToPipeableStream for streaming SSR so each section renders progressively as its data arrives.

lessons.title: Exercise 8: Testing Strategies
lessons.description: Write Playwright E2E tests for cross-route navigation, mock API responses with MSW, record HAR fixtures for deterministic replay, and discuss where contract testing fills the gaps.

lessons.title: Exercise 5: TypeScript References
lessons.description: Add composite builds and project references to each package so TypeScript can do incremental cross-package type checking and skip rechecking packages whose inputs have not changed.

lessons.title: npm vs pnpm vs Bun: Workspace Package Managers
lessons.description: How npm, pnpm, and Bun workspaces compare when your monorepo grows past the point where install speed is the only thing that matters.
